text: The following is a list of episodes for the American animated television series Ben 10. The series was created for Cartoon Network by "Man of Action", a group composed of writers Duncan Rouleau, Joe Casey, Joe Kelly, and Steven T. Seagle. The series was followed by the 2008 sequel series Ben 10: Alien Force. Ben 10's first episode, "And Then There Were 10", first aired on Cartoon Network as a sneak peek on December 27, 2005 during Cartoon Network's "Sneak Peek Week" block, airing alongside other two Cartoon Network original series My Gym Partner's a Monkey and Robotboy, and acquired Canadian YTV series Zixx, before making its official series premiere on January 14, 2006. ==Series overview== ==Episodes== ===Season 1 (2005–06)=== 10 Aliens - Wildmutt, Fourarms, Greymatter, XLR8, Upgrade, Diamondhead, Ripjaws, Stinkfly, Ghostfreak, and Heatblast ===Season 2 (2006)=== 12 Aliens - Fourarms, XLR8, Wildmutt, Stinkfly, Upgrade, Ripjaws, Greymatter, Diamondhead, Heatblast, Wildvine, Cannonbolt, and Ghostfreak *Ben gains access to two new aliens, whom he calls "Cannonbolt" and "Wildvine." *An alternate reality is shown in which Gwen finds the Omnitrix instead of Ben. *Eleven-year-old Kevin Levin returns and becomes a secondary archenemy to Ben. *The master sorcerer Hex returns with his niece Charmcaster. *Gwen reclaimed her "Lucky Girl" hero name after buying the Keystone of Bezel, which further increases her natural combative abilities to superhuman levels. The five Charms of Bezel are recreated but again destroyed. *Ben's ninth alien form, Ghostfreak, turns rogue and attempts to become whole by taking the Omnitrix. *Vilgax allies himself with Kevin and succeeds in removing the Omnitrix from Ben. However, Ben eventually regains the Omnitrix due to Gwen's quick thinking. ===Season 3 (2006–07)=== *Ben and Gwen are thrown into the future where they meet their future selves, with Gwen learning of her natural affinity to magic and mysticism. *Charmcaster makes a comeback, after which Gwen takes her spellbook in the hope of developing and strengthening her own magical powers. *Ben learns that the Omnitrix can obtain more DNA from other aliens via physical contact with it, and gains the forms Blitzwolfer, Snare-Oh, Frankenstrike, and Upchuck. *The rogue Ghostfreak returns with a plan to acquire the Omnitrix and blanket Earth in eternal shadow. *Max Tennyson's old extraterrestrial flame, Xylene, is revealed to have sent the Omnitrix to Earth, intending for it to go to Max for safekeeping, but was accidentally found by Ben. ===Season 4 (2007–08)=== *Gwen Tennyson's magic aura changes from blue to light cyan *The episode "Ken 10" does not take place in present time but rather 32 years into the future, 12 years after "Ben 10,000" *Ben gains two new alien forms: Ditto and Eye Guy. *The Secret of the Omnitrix movie is set as a three-part episode. *The 3D computer-animated movie Destroy All Aliens takes place one year after. *The final 3 episodes of the season were broadcast in high-definition in the United States. ==Shorts== ==Films== ==Home media== {| class="wikitable" |- |+Ben 10 (2005) home video releases ! colspan=2 rowspan=2|Season !! rowspan=2|Episodes !! rowspan=2|Years active !! colspan=2|Release dates |- ! Region 1 |- | style="background:#32CD32| || style="text-align: center"|1 || rowspan=4 style="text-align: center"|13 || style="text-align: center"|2005–06 || February 6, 2007 |- | style="background:#FFB31A| || style="text-align: center"|2 || style="text-align: center"|2006 || October 9, 2007 |- | style="background:#4F4F9F| || style="text-align: center"|3 || style="text- align: center"|2006–07 || The Complete Third Season: March 4, 2008 Ben 10 and Friends (episodes 27–32, 36): April 22, 2014 |- | style="background:#575757| || style="text-align: center"|4 || style="text- align: center"|2007–08 || August 5, 2008 |- | style="background:#FFB31A| ||colspan=2 style="text-align: center"|Films || style="text-align: center"|2007–12 || Race Against Time: April 8, 2008 Secret of the Omnitrix: May 20, 2008 Destroy All Aliens: April 16, 2013 |} == See also == * List of Ben 10: Alien Force episodes * List of Ben 10: Ultimate Alien episodes * List of Ben 10: Omniverse episodes * List of Ben 10 (2016 TV series) episodes == Notes == == References == Ben 10 Category:Cartoon Network-related lists Category:2000s television-related lists Category:Lists of American science fiction television series episodes 2005
title: List of Ben 10 (2005 TV series) episodes
